snippet: Target predicted sales at stores open at least a year would rise 2 to 3 percent this holiday quarter.
abstract: Target Corporation reports third-quarter net income of $637 million, or 96 cents a share, up from $555 million, or 82 cents a share, in the same period a year earlier; Gap reports third-quarter net profit of $308 million, or 63 cents a share, up from $193 million, or 38 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; Sears reports third-quarter net loss of $498 million, or $4.70 a share, compared with a loss of $421 million, or $3.95 a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: Target predicted sales at stores open at least a year would rise 2 to 3 percent this holiday quarter.

headline.seo: Profits Rise at Target and Gap; Sears Posts Loss
headline.main: Profits Rise at Target and Gap, While Sears Posts Loss
headline.print_headline: Profits Rise at Target and Gap, While Sears Posts Loss
